title: Noteworthy

(Photo by Steve Dykes/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 573700585 NAPA, CA - OCTOBER 15: Brendan Steele lines up a putt on the sixth green during the first round of the Frys.com Open on October 15, 2015 in Napa, California. (Photo by Steve Dykes/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: ... more Photo: Steve Dykes Noteworthy 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Steele opens with 63 for lead in Frys.com
NAPA, Calif. — Brendan Steele shot a first-round 63 at the PGA Tour's Frys.com Open that gave him a one-shot lead over Jhonattan Vegas. Twenty-eight players shot 68 or better, including the third-ranked player in the world, Rory McIlroy , who shot a 68.
More golf: South Korea's Sung Hyun Park shot a course-record 10-under 62 to take a four-stroke lead in the LPGA KEB Hana Bank Championship. ... Nicolas Colsaerts and Andy Sullivan share the first-round lead at 7-under 64 at the Portugal Masters. Thomas Pieters , David Drysdale , Eduardo de la Riva and Thomas Aiken are at 65.
Fantasy sports: The Nevada Gaming Control Board says unlicensed daily fantasy sports inside the state must cease and desist as of Thursday, according to media reports. In a notice to licensees, the Nevada Gaming Control Board stated that daily fantasy sports meets the definition of a game or gambling game. The announcement comes one day after reports emerged that the Department of Justice and FBI have launched an investigation into the legality of daily sports operators. FBI agents from the Boston office had reportedly started contacting customers of DraftKings, asking them about their interactions with the company, the Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday. The investigators were reportedly trying to determine whether daily fantasy sports games are a form of gambling. But daily fantasy operators, such as DraftKings and FanDuel, have insisted that they offer a game of skill, which makes it legal under terms of the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act of 2006. The act prohibits financial companies from transferring money to online gambling sites, but so-called games of skill are exempt.
Tennis: Third-round winners at the Shanghai Masters included No. 1 seed Novak Djokovic , No. 4 Stan Wawrinka , No. 5 Tomas Berdych and No. 8 Rafael Nadal No. 12 Kevin Anderson took out No. 6 Kei Nishikori in straight sets that went to tiebreakers. ... No. 2 seed Angelique Kerber , No. 3 Venus Williams , No. 7 Caroline Garcia and No. 8 Alize Cornet won second-round matches in the Hong Kong Open. ... No. 2 Caroline Wozniacki lost her second-round match to Kirsten Flipkens at the Generali Ladies, leaving the Austrian indoor event without any of its top six seeded women in the quarterfinals.
— Wire reports
